summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney and another individual regarding scheduling of interviews related to the Epstein investigation. The AUSA invites the recipient to their office and provides details about upcoming interviews with an inmate.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, works at the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, is scheduling interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: MI=I
persons.context: Recipient of the email who is coordinating with the AUSA about attending interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Colleagues or associates coordinating schedules for Epstein investigation interviews.

events.title: Epstein investigation interview
events.description: Interview relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:30 PM.

events.title: Inmate interview for Epstein investigation
events.description: Another interview of an inmate relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:00 PM.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document shows ongoing Epstein investigation activities in September 2019, after Epstein's death.
Interviews were being conducted with an inmate as part of the investigation.
The correspondence involves a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York.
The email thread shows coordination between legal professionals regarding investigation activities.
